docs.snippet: Despite a late start, the company’s foray into delivering food, a cutthroat $100 billion-plus service industry, eclipses ride hailing in some markets.

headline.print_headline: UberEats Picks Up Steam Against Rivals
headline.main: One Surprise Standout for Uber: Food Delivery

docs.snippet: Apple has generated more wealth for shareholders than any other of the top 50 companies, which account for 40 percent of stock market wealth.

headline.print_headline: The Best Investment Since 1926? It’s Apple

docs.snippet: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority is extending a pilot program encouraging riders to give their seats to the pregnant, older or disabled. Riders say it isn’t working.

headline.print_headline: Hoping in Vain That a Button Will Lead to a Subway Seat
headline.main: ‘Please Offer Me a Seat,’ the Buttons Say. Subway Riders Aren’t Listening.

docs.snippet: In Afghanistan, the photographer Loulou d’Aki made appointments to photograph stylish residents of the capital city. And when the air cooled down, she captured more natural moments in public spaces.

headline.main: A Mix of Tradition and Trend in Kabul

docs.snippet: Many loyal visitors to the Caribbean, including this writer, plan to travel to their island getaways, eager to help out, if only with their tourism dollars.

headline.print_headline: How to Help a Stricken Island Called Home
headline.main: Puerto Rico on Her Mind: How to Help a Stricken Island Called Home

docs.snippet: Also creating communities via clothing at Fendi and MaxMara — and some confusion at Alberta Ferretti.
Sébastien Bras, who runs Le Suquet restaurant in Laguiole, France, doesn’t want the stress. He’s not the first to seek to surrender the accolade.

headline.print_headline: Acclaimed French Chef Seeks to Rid Himself Of a Coveted Honor
headline.main: Acclaimed French Chef to Michelin: Take My Stars, Please

docs.snippet: Thursday: Checking in on California’s earthquake warning system, pro surfers compete in the San Joaquin Valley, and snow arrives in Tahoe.

headline.main: California Today: Mexico Has a Quake Warning System. Where is California’s?

docs.snippet: Friday: Taking stock of Xavier Becerra’s lawsuits, Duncan Hunter calls for an attack on North Korea, and a review of “Pacific Standard Time: LA/LA.”

headline.main: California Today: Suing the Trump Administration, Again and Again and Again

docs.snippet: Pete Wells, The Times’s restaurant critic, discussed how he avoids cameras to protect his identity and how technology has transformed the dining scene.

headline.print_headline: Smile and Say Cheese: Training the Lens on Food
headline.main: Avoiding Cameras While Training the Lens on Food
